alert.note: Alert for Grant; Lincoln (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 4:23PM PDT until July 10 at 5:15PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central and East Central Washington, including the following counties, in Central Washington, Grant. In East Central Washington, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 730 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Banks Lake South, Wilbur, Coulee City, Almira, Creston, Hartline, Sherman and Coffeepot Lake. - Expect torrential rain and ponding on Highway 2 between Wilbur and Banks Lake. Heavy rain has also fallen in Douglas county on Highway 2 west of Banks Lake to the community of Douglas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
